attributes.action: Legalise the use of Electric scooters that do not exceed 15mph on cycle paths.
attributes.additional_details: E Scooters, although I do realise there are some that exceed 15 mph, I belive that this speed should be deemed safe and scooters over this speed should be placed under review.
attributes.background: Legalise the use of electric scooters owned by people that do not exceed 15mph which is the same as many electric bikes. The use of electric scooters around the UK or at least in major cities would ease congestion, cut down on emissions, cut down the spread of coronavirus and make many commutes easy

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions calling for similar actions:

Allow 'Personal Electric Vehicles' to use cycle lanes and walkways: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301014

Make electric scooters legal to reduce our carbon footprint / cut emissions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301579

Since you started your petition the Government has launched a consultation for legalising rental e-scooter trails. You can find out more about the Governments proposals here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/legalising-rental-e-scooter-trials-defining-e-scooters-and-rules-for-their-use/legalising-rental-e-scooter-trials
